ygData.subject: Re: Suggestions for a level 6 baby bard
ygData.msgSnippet: ... If it s adventures you want you may be interested in visiting Splitpaw. It is a dungeon in the middle of south karana. There are around 5-7 splitpaw gnolls
ygData.messageBody:
> Heya,
>
> You fine folks have any suggestions for a level 6 Bard on where to hunt?
> Im was born in, and live around the Qeynos area. I have been helping keep
> the rat population down, and lately have been working on keeping the
> dreaded Black Burrow entrance free of Scouts and Guards. However I am in
> need of greater adventure. As a bard, I need great adventures to write
> songs about.

If it's adventures you want you may be interested in visiting Splitpaw. It is a
dungeon in the middle of south karana. There are around 5-7 splitpaw gnolls
outside that are 5th - 6th level. I believe it to be the best place for going
from 6th to 9th (assuming you can live with a long walk if you die). With a
group you could even head inside and hunt everything before the first bridge
(you'll see it when you go in a little and thru some doors).

> ooc: So if I help someone who is a level 23 warrior find their body, and
> they give me stuff, is this considered twinking?

In my opinion, no. Others may differ.

> ooc2: Ever notice how many of us bards have names that start with T?

Ever notice how many of us bards have names with T,A,L,I,E,N? ;-)

(so far I've meet Taelan, Taylin and now Talien. small world)

> -Talien (Bloodguard) Innorook


Taelin
Songweavers of Kelethin
The Rathe
